loans.name: Max

texts.en: Max is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. Max is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services. Max has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Max hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services

loans.name: Nere

texts.en:
Nere works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Nere requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothings.

She has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

In the future, Nere would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothings.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Miss Um is from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, where there is lots of fertile land for farmers to grow their crops. Um is now 32 years old and is a widowed woman living without a child. For a livelihood, she works for a garment factory in a position as sewing staff and she usually gets her payment monthly. She said that if she tries to work overtime, she will be able to make more bonus in addition to her income.

To upgrade her standard of living, Um wants to change her lifestyle and the way she works for her income. She wishes to open a grocery store, from which she can sell breakfast, lunch, dinner and soft drinks especially to garment workers. Yet she doesn’t have enough capital to start her planned business. 

Now she has come to HKL for the fourth time to borrow some funds needed to open and operate a grocery store located near a garment factory in the province. With the increase in income, she will fix her thatched wall that is old and broken.

loans.use: to open and operate a grocery store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: This time, Luzviminda is borrowing 10,000 PHP to fund her vegetable garden. This business was previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF and continues to provide Luzviminda and her family with income that is improving their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Rosario

texts.en: Ma. Rosario works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a cellphone repair shop business in the Philippines. Ma. Rosario requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her cellphone repair shop. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Rosario would like to save enough money to build another business.

loans.use: buy new tools and equipment for her cellphone repair business.

loans.name: Alpaquitas - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Alpaquitas, esta compuesto por  nueve integrantes, Siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta es la Sra. Brenda, ella casada tiene 39 años con   2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica al tejido y venta de ropa y chompas de lana de alpaca, su taller se encuentra en la zona de Sopocachi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Brenda utilizara este préstamo para compra de lana  para el tejido de chompas de lana ya que tiene pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar su capital de arranque, la Sra. Brenda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son abrir una microempresa en sociedad, y  va a utilizar los beneficios buscando un mercado ya establecido y ofrecer no solo chompas sino otras prendas en lana de alpaca, la Sra. Brenda se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Emprendimiento Alpaquitas communal bank consists of nine members, seven women and two men.  Brenda, 39, is the president. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Brenda knits and sells clothing and sweaters made of alpaca wool and her workshop is in the Sopocachi area.  This loan will be the first cycle in the institution and she will use it to buy wool to knit into sweaters since she has orders to fill.  The reason why she is requesting the loan is to increase her working capital.  Brenda has challenges in her business that are to start a micro business partnership and she will use the money to look for an established market so as to be able to sell not only sweaters but also other pieces of clothing in alpaca wool.  Brenda is happy and grateful that the institution has offered her support.

loans.use: to buy supplies to knit wool sweaters

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos, es habitante del municipio de San Ignacio, junto a su esposa la cual es comerciante de frutas, ellos tienen hijos ya todos mayores de edad, los planes hacia su familia es poder realizar una cocina a su esposa ya que por más de treinta años a cocinado en fogón y eso le ha afectado los pulmones, don Santos se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una producción de calidad , en cuanto al tamaño, color y sabor . El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios que le permita el próximo años obtener un mejor cultivo y así venderlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en: Santos is a resident of the town of San Ignacio. With his wife, who is a fruit merchant, he has grown children. His plan for his family is to be able to make a kitchen for his wife, since for more than thirty years she has cooked with a wood burning oven and this has affected her lungs. Santos grows pineapple, and his biggest problem are pests, since his crop lacks fertilizer and the necessary materials to get a quality product in regards to size, color and flavor. He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and the necessary materials that will allow him to have a good crop in the coming years and sell at a better price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials.

loans.name: Yelibeth

texts.es: La socia es una mujer muy trabajdora y estaba trabajando como secretaria en la caja de un muy conocido bar restaurante turistico, la socia tambien se esta apoyandose economicamente con la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, la socia continua con sus clases de ingles. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra de productos como perfumes, cremas, labiales, entre otros para la venta.
texts.en: This member is a very hardworking woman, and she was working as a secretary in a very well known tourist restaurant. She also supports herself selling beauty products via catalog.  She continues to study English, and she wants the loan to invest in buying products such as perfume, creams, lipsticks and more to sell.

loans.use: to invest in buying products such as perfume, creams, lipsticks and more to sell.

loans.name: Maria Hede

texts.en:
Maria Hede, 42, is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past four years Maria Hede has run a general store. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Hede’s ambition is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is married and has 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vangie is 34 years old and has six children who are in school and the other has already a work and a family of their own.

Vangie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for fishing.

Vangie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 51 years old, married, and has six children.

Edna earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs. Edna has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Edna is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lepeka

texts.en: Lepeka is 44 years old.  She is married and has 6 children. She owns and operates a small canteen, selling food products like donuts, sandwiches, and other snacks in her community. She has one year of experience in this business. Lepeka is asking for this loan of WST 1000 to purchase ingredients to make additional food products for sale. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family and improve her business. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food products, such as donuts and other snacks

loans.name: Liva

texts.en: Liva is a 21 years old and unmarried. She owns and operates a canteen at the local school, selling a variety of snacks and lunch items, like pork buns and sandwiches. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Liva would like to use this loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional products for sale. She will use her profits to support her family and improve her business. This is her 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale in her canteen

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is 62 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting cocoa for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  

Lusila needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to improve/expand her business.

Lusila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lusila's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is 39 years old and married with five children. She sells baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Kalala needs a loan 1,450 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase additional ingredients for products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Kalala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Kalala's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baked goods.

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito is 40 years old and married with 10 children. She raises fish for sale. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Fiapito needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase supplies and equipment to raise fish. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fiapito joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fiapito's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for raising fish.

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza de 53 años de edad invirtió su anterior credikiva en la compra de ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos etc. Con ello mantuvo un buen inventario de mercancías con los que satisfizo las necesidades de sus clientes que le compraron y la de ella de vender y tener un capital de trabajo adicional para comprar en más volumen. En la actualidad planea recibir un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará nuevos productos que ahora rotan más rápidamente, porque sus cliente solicitan diariamente, es decir todos los de la canasta familiar, aceite, azúcar, sal, refrescos , con estas mercancías su inventario mejorará una vez mas y así irá fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Continúen brindando ese maravilloso apoyo a las microempresas mediante créditos a bajo costo. “
texts.en: Adalgiza is 53 and invested her previous loan with credikiva in buying groceries, canned goods, soft drinks etc.  With it she maintained good levels of inventory with which she satisfied the needs of her clients to buy and hers to sell and have more working capital to buy more volumes.  Currently she plans to get new credikiva loan which which she will buy new products that turnaround faster, because her clients request them daily, these are basic products, oil, sugar, salt, soft drinks; with this merchandise her inventory will be better once more and she will strengthen working capital.  Her message to Kiva lenders is: "Continue to provide this wonderful support to micro-enterprises though low cost credit".

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, salt and soft drinks at higher volumes.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children and owns a water tap from which she sells water to her neighbors. She dug a bore hole and started selling the water.

Given the high cost of living, Caroline has decided to apply for a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to start poultry farming. She will invest the additional income from the loan.

loans.use: To start poultry farming.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with three children. Her husband is a mason. For the past two years Aba has sold footwear in the town of Nkromofokrom near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist in paying the children’s school fees.

Aba will use her 150 GHS loan from CRAN to purchase more footwear to sell. Her ambition is to grow her business with her anticipated increase in profits.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Malindi, Kenya.  He is single and runs a transport business.  When Joseph completed his driving school, a friend of his gave him a motorcycle to carry people and goods around the area.  

He earned money from this venture and was also able to save some money.  He then joined Milango to access gain access to more credit.  Joseph is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle.  The main challenges he faces in this business include the high cost of fuel and the seasonal business climate.  

He looks forward to continuing with the transport business and to increasing the number of motorcycles in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a dairy farmer who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She has been in the business for the last two years. She has two children. Merceline received a cow from her parents and kept the cow till it gave birth, and has been selling the milk since then.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy another local cow and also to repair the cattle shed. The challenge in the current business is some clients not paying on time and the high costs of transportation. Her future ambition is to increase the stock of animals on her dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy another local cow and also repair the cattle shed.

loans.name: Adelbert

texts.en:
Adelbert is a hotelier living in Kongowea, Kenya. The cafe has been operating for eighteen years. This is one of the busiest in Kenya and is thought of as the largest open air market in East Africa. It therefore has a large number of customers at any given time. He is married and has three school going children. He also operates a pub and has some rental houses from where he collects rent at the end of every month.
The business employs six other people. Adelbert is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase cafe food stuff e.g. meat, flour etc. 
Adelbert’s business faces the challenge of lack of adequate capital and competition from like businesses. The additional income from this loan will help him pay for school fees. He desires to increase the business assets in future.

loans.use: To purchase hotel food stuff e.g. meat, flour etc.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 34 años tiene un taller de reparación de motocicletas, ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras y también tiene una miscelánea,  en el municipio de Malambo a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en la edad de 11 a 15 años. Aprendió el oficio de reparación automotriz  en el departamento de Antioquia, en un taller donde se desempeñaba como ayudante y de donde adquirió su mayor experiencia. Desde hace 5 años, llegó desplazado con su familia, al departamento del Atlántico y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios con préstamos a  personas particulares y a un alto costo, pero se propuso trabajar y con ello salió de todos estos créditos y una vez lo hizo se capitalizó poco a poco y con la ayuda de su cónyuge, hace tres años emprendió un negocio de miscelánea y posteriormente adquirió lavadoras para alquilarlas a la comunidad objeto. Hoy está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara repuestos para motos en mayor proporción, pues los requiere entre sus inventarios como insumos, para responder a su creciente clientela en su oferta de  servicios de mantenimiento automotriz.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 34 years old, has a motorcycle repair shop, offers washing machine rental service, and also has a general store in the Malambo municipality, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, where he lives with his partner and 3 children aged 11 to 15 years old.  He learned auto repair in the Antioquia department, in a shop where he was employed as an assistant and where he got most of his experience. 

5 years ago he moved with his family to the Atlántico department, and he started his own business venture with loans from other people and at a high cost. But he set himself to work, and he paid off those loans. Once he did that he reinvested little by little with the help with his partner. 3 years ago he started his general store and later acquired washing machines to help out to people in the community. 

Today he is applying for his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which he will buy motorcycle part in bulk since he needs those in stock in order to respond to his growing clientele in his business offering automotive maintenance services.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Et is aged 45 and a married woman. She has been blessed with three children, living together with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She operates a selling business in her community to provide satisfied products to her customers. She is friendly and sociable to local people in the region, that is why there are many people buying and using her products. Et’s spouse sells sugar cane juice from a trailer to contribute to raising the family.

As of now, Et would like to look for some funds from HKL to buy a used motorcycle and connect it with a trailer at the side (as shown in the photo) in order to sell sugar cane juice to distant areas around the commune. She hopes that this project will work well and thereby increase more productivity of sales. She is very happy and appreciative for the generosity and kindness from our lenders.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle and connect it with a trailer at the side in order to sell sugar cane juice to distant areas around the community.

loans.name: Earng

texts.en:
Earng, 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running a sewing shop and breeding pigs for over ten years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about 4 per day. 

One of Earng's children is employed in Korea and earns USD 15 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Eang is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more cloth in order to sew clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to purchase eight sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell. In addition, she plans to rebuild her present house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth in order to sew clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sok Leang

texts.en: Sok Leang, 45, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing noodles to sell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Her husband runs the business of selling bread and earns about USD 10 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sok Leang is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and delivering her noodles to sell. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new wooden house and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and delivering her noodles to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married and has two children. Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store. She has been in her business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mae is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase daily-use products such as noodles, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase daily-use products such as noodles, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You, 41, has been married and lived in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She devoiced her husband many years ago and without any children. Presently she has two nieces who live together with her. Both of them are employed and work everyday. You’s main source of income is from agricultural business, particularly crops husbandry. She grows like rice, potatoes and some types of bean on her own farm followed by the seasons, earning an average of income of USD 5.00 each day.

As of now, You has requested credit to purchase a used motorcycle for her nieces to commute to their workplaces, thereby avoiding the cost of taking motor-taxis services, which increases her daily expenses. You has borrowed and repaid her previous 2 loans from HKL already. This is her third cycle loan. She is determined to pay her loan back regularly and punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for both of her nieces to commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Japheth Otieno Ombae

texts.en: Japheth is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. He does a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som is from Pouk district, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is 39 years old and married. She has a single child who is still attending a local school in the province. To make a living, Som works on the rice field and owns a fish selling business. She goes through the community since the early the morning and sells her fish from an old bicycle. She earns approximately USD 2.50 per day.

She is requesting a new cycle loan,  the fourth loan, in the sum of KHR 500,000, which will be used to purchase a new bicycle and sacks of fertilizers to put on her farmland. In the future, Som plans to save some of her profit for the purpose of emergencies for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle and sacks of fertilizers to put on her farmland.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Gladis, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad pero aún vive en su casa a pesar de que ya está comprometido. El marido es agricultor y ganadero.
 
Ella tiene un local en sus casa en el cual se dedica a vender queso y cuajada, este es un delicioso plato hecho con leche a la cual le agregan algunos ingredientes para preparar el queso y de esto resulta este delicioso plato que es muy apetecido por los turistas y personas de su localidad, ella lo sirve acompañado de uno o dos plátanos asados de acuerdo a las preferencias de sus clientes. A su local llegan muchas personas de otras ciudades para servirse sus productos, lleva 11 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar dos mesas y ocho sillas para brindar más comodidad a sus clientes, leche, azúcar, cuajo y plátanos para preparar los alimentos. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida diaria y en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in an area called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistorical culture. Here a majority of the inhabitants work different jobs like crafts and general commerce. 

Gladis, 49 years old, lives here. She’s in a common law marriage and has one son who’s already an adult but lives at home despite being engaged. Her husband is a farmer and rancher. 

She has a shop in her home where she sells cheese and curd. This is a delicious dish made with milk to which you add different ingredients to make cheese, and the result is a delicious dish much-loved by tourists and locals. She serves it accompanied by one or two plantains grilled to the customers’ liking. Many people from other cities come to her shop to order her products. She’s had her business for 11 years, and it’s going very well.  

This loan is to buy two tables and eight chairs (to make her customers more comfortable), milk, sugar, rennet, and plantains to make the dishes. This is her 5th loan cycle in the communal bank, and she enjoys the help that they give with loans.  

Her dream is to get ahead in her daily life and in  her business.

loans.use: to buy two tables, eight chairs, milk, sugar, rennet, and plantains.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is 37 years old. She is married to Gatama and together they have one child. She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past eleven years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of clothes for resale and to pay for transport.

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Angela Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y una chica de 12 años que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual además de comida también vende la deliciosa cuajada que es un plato hecho con leche y que a las personas les encanta. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 y le ayudan sus hijos  cuando ellos están desocupados, ya son  cuatro  años que tiene su negocio y le está yendo muy bien. También está vendiendo ropa la cual lo hace en su local o puerta a puerta en las noches, ella deja a crédito estas prendas y cobra cada ocho días. 

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos y ropa para la venta. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta sus opciones de ganar su propio dinero.
 
Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en sus negocios y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in an area called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi which is a city rich with pre-historical culture. Here a majority of the inhabitants do different jobs like crafts or general commerce. 

Here lives Angela, 43 years old. She’s married and has four children, 3 who are grown and one 12 year old daughter who studies in high school. Two of her children live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur.

She has a small restaurant in her house where she sells food as well as delicious curd which is a dish made with milk and that people love. She works every day from 8:00 am until 3:00 pm. Her children help her when they’re not busy. She’s already had her business for four years, and it’s going very well. Also she sells clothes which she has in her store or which she sells door to door at night. She allows credit for these items, and she collects every eight days. 

This loan is to buy food to make the dishes and clothing to sell. She’s been with the communal bank for more than two years, and she likes it because each of the loans increase her means to earn more of her own money. 

Her dreams are to continue growing in her businesses and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida, 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making broom to sell for over four years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 9 per day. 

Due to the difficulties in the family’s transportation, Lida is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to save money on her transportation expenses and use those funds to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells secondhand cloth and towels, which she has done for 4 years. She has 4 children and is married to a driver. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their accomodation and utility bills. Aba needs this loan to purchase more second hand cloths and towels to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand cloths.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand cloths and towels to sell.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.ru:
Грачик (Hrachik) занимается сельским хозяйством в деревне Гехи (Geghi), Сьюникского региона, на протяжении долгих лет. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот,  а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Жена Грачика помогает ему на ферме и вместе они изготавливают сыр, масло и мацони из полученного молока. Большую часть молочных продуктов, мясо, овощи и фрукты Грачик продает своим постоянным клиентам.   
Грачику 54 года и он проживает в деревне Гехи. Он женат и у него трое детей: две дочери и сын. Сын Грачика женат и живет отдельно от родителей. Обе дочери учатся в институте на платном отделении. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством Грачик содержит свою семью и платит за обучение своих дочерей. Раньше Грачик работал на Горно-обогатительном комбинате буровиком. 
Грачику необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для постройки нового более надежного хлева для своего крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Hrachik does farming in the village of Geghi, in the Syuninskiy region during many years. He breeds large horned cattle and also grows fruits and vegetables. Hrachik's wife helps him in the farm and together they make cheese, butter and matsoni from the milk. Large part of the dairy products, meat, fruits and vegetables are sold to Hrachik's regular customers.

Hrachik is 54 years old and lives in the village of Geghi. He is married and has three children: two daughters and one son. Hrachik's son is married and lives separately from the parents. Both daughters study in college on the paid tuition. Thanks to the farming business Hrachik is able to support his family and pay for their daughters' education. Hrachik used to work as a driller on the mining and processing plant.

Hrachik needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to build a new and more reliable cattle shed for his large horned cattle herd.

loans.use: to construct a new cattle shed.

loans.name: Suk

texts.en: Suk, 53, is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making broom to sell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. Due to difficulties in the family’s transportation, Suk is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to save money on her transportation expenses and use the funds to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kamangu

texts.en:
Kamangu is 53 years old. He is married to Jane and together they have one child. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase more chicks to rear, poultry feed and also to expand his poultry structures.

Kamangu hopes to be a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to rear, poultry feeds and also to expand his poultry structures.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn, 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her two children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulties in the family’s transportation, Yoeurn is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved from transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Angla Azuncion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual cinco días a la semana se dedica a vender sus productos, instala su negocio desde las 8h00 y es una sola jornada hasta las 18h00. Lleva más de diez años realizando esta labor, también vende otros productos dependiendo de la temporada, en la actualidad va a invertir en comprar útiles escolares además de ropa ya que se viene la época de entrada a clases y es cuando más se venden estos productos. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y útiles escolares. Lleva cinco  ciclos en el Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que les brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es  tener un gran local en el centro de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Chimborazo meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the joyfulness of the people. 

Here we meet Angela, 44 years old. She’s married and has three children aged 17, 16, and 14 years old. They all study in university and high school. Her husband is a retailer. 

Besides being a housewife, Angela is a salesperson. She sells all sorts of clothes, and she has a small stall in the center of the city from which she sells her products five days out of the week. She’s at her business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She’s been doing this work for over 10 years, and she also sells other products depending on the time of year. Right now she’s going to invest in the purchase of school supplies as well as clothing since the time when school starts is coming and that’s when she sells those products more. 

This loan will be used in the purchase of clothing and school supplies. She’s been in five loan cycles with the communal bank, and she likes it for the benefits and help that it brings to the members. 

Her dream is to have a big store in the center of Portoviejo.

loans.use: to buy clothes and school supplies.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 58 years old. She lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District with her family: husband, Otar, her 35 year old son, daughter-in-law and two grand-daughters. The children go to kindergarten. All adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. In particular, they have 2 milk cows. Dali produces cheese and sells it to local dairy products retailers. Also, the family owns a greenhouse and a plot of land. Dali and Otar grow greens and cucumbers and sells, on average, 3 tonnes of greens and 1 tonne of cucumbers per year. Total average monthly income for the family is 850 Laris. 

Dali has requested credit for constructing another greenhouse. She will purchase materials (wooden pillars and polyethylene covers) and the family members will construct the greenhouse themselves. Dali will grow additional greens and cucumbers there. The family will harvest and sell more greengrocery products and their income will increase. It will allow the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa sells cloth, which she has done for 8 years now. She lives together with her 4 children at Jukwa, near Abura. Adowa uses her income to pay her utiliity and accomodation bills. Adow will use her loan to purchase cloth to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Guljan obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and raise sales of milk and meat products. Now, Guljan has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS for purchasing additional cattle for fattening and reselling.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en:
Anahit manages her own business: public food service. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. Anahit rents a room in a food market's territory where she cooks meals such as salads, barbeque, soups, garnish, etc. In a rented room, Anahit places 3 table and chair sets so her clients have the opportunity to lunch on-site or to order the takeout food from Anahit as well. 

Anahit’s husband and her elder son help her in the business: they cook barbeque and other grilled foods and buy merchandise for the business as well. Anahit’s cafe serves clients who are food market workers and sellers. Anahit is 48 years old and she lives in Vanadzor. Anahit’s younger son is serving in the army and her daughter is married, living separately from her parents. 

Anahit is asking for a $ 2,300 loan to buy new tableware sets and food products for her business and also new curtains to decorate her cafe. This is Anahit’s secon loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy new tableware sets and food products for her business and also new curtains to decorate her cafe.

loans.name: Seom

texts.en:
Seom, 49, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over ten years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and earn approximately USD 9 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Seom is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and fuel to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and fuel to use in her farming work.

loans.name: Christopher Agisa Maina

texts.en: Christopher is 24 years old, married and has one child. He does motor vehicle repairs to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna lives in the village of Bandza, Martvili District, in the western part of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maka, daughter, and 61-year-old mother. Datuna and Maka run the agricultural activities of the family, which is the main source of income for the family. They have a 220 sq meter greenhouse and a plot of land. They grow cucumbers and tomatoes, which are sold locally as well as in nearby villages. The family has been involved in this business for 11 years. 

During this period, they have been working hard to expand their farm. Datuna received a good harvest of vegetables last year, which was sold for a convenient price. He already covered his first Kiva loan. Now Datuna has requested credit for the expansion of the family's agricultural business. With the borrowed money he will purchase materials for greenhouse construction – wooden pillars and polyethylene cover. He will construct the greenhouse and double the amount of harvested and sold cucumbers. The income of the family will increase. Datuna plans to make some savings from the increased income to construct a third greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is married. He has five children, aged between 6 and 15. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 9 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more out put and he wants to renovate the house as well from the profits that he will obtain.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband and a son in the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband works as a salesman and a son studies at the high school. She has started lingerie retails in a shop counter in the biggest international market of the city. During these 4 years, she already made numbers of regular customers and improve the family's income. The business has been successful in the latest years. Therefore, she is planning to expand the business and add another shop counter. 

Battsetseg is a good-natured and gentle woman who says, "I would like to expand the business by having another shop counter and getting the supplies in there in large quantities to raise the household". The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT for the business to purchase more lingerie.

loans.use: to purchase more lingerie.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is married. He has six children. All of them attend different schools. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, build savings and renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor.

loans.name: Walter Jesus Hernandez Bernaola

texts.es:
Walter vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso en cualquier época del año, asimismo tiene como una de sus actividades principales la agricultura, en especial la cosecha de uva, espárragos, pallares. Walter es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, junto a su esposa tienen tres hijos cuyas edades comprenden 16,12 y 1 año. Con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado de la ciudad; el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 70 clientes; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo frescos.

Walter está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada el podrá comprar mercadería de temporada, en especial frutas cítricas para ofrecer en periodo de invierno; lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y así seguir luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño.” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en:
Walter lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its year-round warm climate. He works in agriculture for one of his primary jobs, especially in the harvest of grapes, asparagus, and lima beans. Walter is a very hard working and enthusiastic person. Together with his wife they have 3 children who are 16, 12, and 1 year old. With a lot of hard work he was able to start a business selling fruit in the city market. He works around 8 hours a day, and he can have about 70 customers. He believes that his business is going well because he offers quality products that are above all fresh. 

Walter is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help he’s gotten, he’s been able to buy seasonal merchandise, especially citrus fruits to sell in the winter months. That allows him to have more income and keep on working so that he can achieve his biggest dream: “to have his own store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (citrus fruit for the winter months)

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 3 kids in the skid row of the capital city in Mongolia. Her husband works for the National Emergency Management Agency of Mongolia. Her oldest son works for a private company and her 2 other children are at college and high school. 

Erdenebayar operates a meat trading business in the local market at a shop counter. She start her business in 1998. During these past few years, she has made many regular customers. They appreciate the products that she supplies. She plans to expand the business to purchase the products by wholesale. Erdenebayar is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by getting the supplies in large quantities and trade them in wholesale". The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy the meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. He does tailoring to earn a living, he has been in the business for 20 years and has employed 2 people. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material.

loans.name: Akujo

texts.en:
Akujo lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and has been in the business for two years. She is 35 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Akujo heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидии 43 года, замужем, мать двух дочерей. Дочери замужем, одна живет в России, а вторая в Бишкеке (столица Кыргызстана).
Лидия родилась в простой (5 детей) семье фермера. Она была самостоятельной с детства и очень любила помогать матери по уходу за домом. По окончании школы Лидия вышла замуж. Ее супруг уже работал на тот момент в местном колхозе и после свадьбы колхоз им выделил дом для проживания, который позже они выкупили. Затем Лидия устроилась на работу в этом же колхозе в качестве доярки. Год спустя, в 1989 году, у них родилась старшая дочка, а в 1991 году вторая дочка. В поиске дополнительного дохода для своей семьи,  Лидия начала заниматься разведением скота, использовав для этого сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря приложенным усилиям  и настойчивости Лидии, доходы от бизнеса позволили в 2002 году купить новый дом.  
Сейчас в хозяйстве у Лидии имеются 3 телки, 12 свиней и 9 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Лидия обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух телок. Доходы от кредита Лидия планирует вложить в  увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем  мечтает купить внедорожник.
texts.en:
Lidiya is 43 years old, married and is a mother of two daughters. Her daughters are married and one of them lives in Russia and another one in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

Lidiya was born in the simple family of a farmer with five children. She was independent since childhood and loved to help her mother to take care of the home. Lidiya got married right after she graduated from high school. Her husband was already working in the local collective farm at the time and after their wedding the farm had given them a house to live which they have bought out later. Lidiya has found a job in the same farm as a milkmaid. A year later in 1989 their oldest daughter was born and then in 1991 their second daughter. In search of an additional income for her family Lidiya started doing animal husbandry and used an amount  of 2,000 som (KGS) to start the business. Thanks to the efforts and perseverance of Lidya the income from the business allowed them to buy a new home in 2002.

Right now Lidiya's business has three heifers, twelve pigs and nine sheep. Lidiya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy two heifers with a goal to further grow her business. She plans to invest the income form the loan in the increase of headcount of cattle and in the future she dreams to buy an SUV.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mirtha Iris

texts.es:
Mirtha tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, a los cuales cría sola y por los cuales sale adelante  con mucha dedicación porque para ella son los más importante que ella tiene y son su razón de vivir y levantarse cada día con mucha fuerza; Mirtha vive junto a sus hijos en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, por su agricultura y por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Mirtha es una mujer muy luchadora, ella estudio para ser auxiliar de educación, anteriormente enseñaba en un colegio de educación primaria, pero el dinero no le alcanzaba ya que la paga era muy poca pero lo hacía con gusto ya que le fascina estudiar; gracias a esa lucha  y sobre todo ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de menús, el cual ya tiene 3 años le encanta cocinar por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque lo hace con gusto y su sazón es muy buena.

Mirtha está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a  la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina y tripley para poder mejorar la instalación de su negocio, lo que le permitirá dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y tener las herramientas necesarias para poder realizar mejor su trabajo, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño.” Tener un restaurante y que sus hijos sean unos fabulosos chefs”.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 33, is a mother of three children who she has raised on her own, and who because of her dedication have come out ahead. They are the most important thing to her, and are her reason for living and getting up each day to work hard. Mirtha lives with her children in the city of Imperial, which is known for a warm climate, agriculture, and generous people. Mirtha is a very hardworking woman. She studied to be a teacher's assitant and used to teach in a primary school, but she didn't make enough money. They paid her very little but she enjoyed the work because she loves to study. Thanks to her efforts and savings, she was able to start her business selling food, which she has been doing for three years now. She loves to cook and she thinks that's why her business is doing well - because she does it with pleasure and her food tastes good.

Mirtha is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a stove and an adapter to be able to improve her business, which will allow her to provide greater comfort for her customers and to have the needed tools to improve her work. This will increase her income so that she can keep working towards her dream - having a restaurant and having her children be fabulous chefs.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a three-way adapter to make improvements to her business.

loans.name: Dzimbabwe Group

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Janet from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with five children, four attending school. Janet runs a retail business selling basic commodities. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says that the main challenge faced is expensive licensing of the tuck shop (a small food-selling retailer). Janet has requested a loan of $750 to buy groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance the family welfare. In the future, Janet plans to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Tserentogtoh

texts.en: Tserentogtoh is a 36-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 kids in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is tailor. She sews deel, Mongolian traditional clothes. His older kid studies in high school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He has been running a taxi service business since 2004. During these 8 years, his business has become well known in the local area and the regular customers always appreciate the service. His van has 5 seats and he drives to the capital city and sometimes to the neighboring provinces. He is not only good at driving but also he knows the roads and direction well even though they are "earth" roads (dirt roads). Due to the problems of "earth" roads, he faced a need to replace the motor of the van. Tserentogtoh is a bright man who says "I would like to continue successfully my business further by fixing the car. This is the only financial source for the family. I really want to improve our household by continuing the business". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to get the motor for the car and buy sewing materials for her wife business.

loans.use: To buy a motor for the car and buy sewing materials for her wife's business

loans.name: Anthere

texts.en:
Anthere is married. He has five children who are aged between 3 and 20 years. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and renovate his house. In the picture background, other agricultural borrowers are observing the cameraman.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 30 year old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 
Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Santo Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santo Niño está compuesto por seis mujeres emprendedoras, decidieron llamarse así porque cerca de sus hogares hay una capilla de la Iglesia con este nombre.
Entre las integrantes se encuentra Isabel, quien vive en unión libre yes madre de dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando (15 y 6 años);algo que la distingue es que es una mujer que lucha por saliradelante,ya que actualmente trabaja en una maquiladora donde producen volantes para autos y además vende lencería. Su interés por este micronegocio  comenzó cuando su sobrina le llevó algunamercancía para vender y tuvo aceptación.Las ventas se realizan en su domicilio y quiere invertir en cantidades más grandes para incrementar el negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda establecida y dedicarse totalmente a ella, así podrá darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y tener más tiempo para ellos.
texts.en:
Santo Niño group is made up of six entrepreneurial women. They decided to name their group this because there is a chapel near their homes with this name. 

Among the members is Isabel who is in a civil union and is a mother to two children who are in school (15 and 16 years old). One of the things that distinguishes her is that she is a woman who struggles to get ahead. Currently she works in a maquiladora [factory] where they produce steering wheels for cars and she also sells lingerie. Her interest in this micro-business began when her niece brought her some merchandise to sell and it was received well. She makes her sales from her home and she wants to invest in larger quantities of to expand the business. 

Her dream is to establish a store and commit herself completely to it. In this way she will be able to giver her children a better future and have more time for them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and be able to expand their business.

loans.name: Angel De Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo Angel de luz está compuesto por 6 mujeres trabadoras; particularmente este grupo se integro en el preciso momento que mas necesitaban apoyo para sacar adelante sus negocios, debido a esto decidieron llamarse así. Dentro de las integrantes del grupo se encuentra Guadalupe Milagros, quien es una mujer comerciante de 33 años, casada y con cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 2, de los cuales 3 se encuentran estudiando. Ella comenzó comercializando pequeñas cantidades de ropa en su casa, hasta que poco a poco se incrementaron las ventas debido a su esfuerzo y actualmente se encuentra en un mercado público. Ella anhela poder tener un negocio grande para ayudar a otras personas generando fuentes de empleo, y que sus hijos estudien para lograr un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Angel de Luz group is made up of six working women. This group in particular came together at the very moment when they most needed support to get their businesses ahead. This is why they decided to give the group this name. 

Among the members of the group is Guadalupe Milagros who is a 33-year-old woman who works in retail. She is married and has four children who are 15, 13, 11, and 2, three of which are in school. She began selling small amounts of clothes from her home. Little by little the sales increased due to her effort and now she sells in a public market. 

She hopes to be able to have a large business to help other by creating sources of employment. She also hopes that her children study so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to stock their business with merchandise.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married. He has four children. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and to build a house if the profits are enough to do so.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She has a food stall and has been in this business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school.
 
Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married. He has seven children between 12 and 25 years old. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to receive this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife. Because of Sevak's and his wife’s desire to have children, they are doing the best they can to enhance their life and build a good future. His wife has been working as saleswoman at one of the local companies for eight years. As for him, Sevak has been working in designing jewelry from his home since 2007. He works with a high professionalism and has his loyal customers. 

Today, he’s in need to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials for his business such as jewelry molds and shapes in addition to many other items. This will facilitate his business operations and boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to make to open his own jewelry shop.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business such as jewelry molds

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en:
Maarouf is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s trying his best and working hard in order to be able to satisfy his family's needs. 

After one year of experience in used car sales, Maarouf decided to start working on his own on a free-lance basis in 2005. In parallel, he’s working as a manager in a pastry shop. 

Today, he wants to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new car for his business. He notes that this will increase the number of his cars and therefore boost his sales. In the future, he plans to open his own cars showroom.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his business

loans.name: Atuwezeshe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyirabimana, leader du groupe d’affaire «Atuwezeshe », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 50  ans, mariée, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous et d’autres ont leurs propres ménages. Son mari est un fonctionnaire. Elle est  sociétaire d’un cafeteria. Il y a  10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  4eme  crédit de Hekima. Actuellement, cette cliente se retrouve en situation de baisse d’activité suite au déménagement de son lieu stratégique vente vers un autre lieu isolé du centre ville. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 bidons de lait yogourts à revendre, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et diversifier les activités.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. il sied de signaler que sur cette photo, certaines mamans portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Nyirabimana is the leader of the Atuwezeshe group.  She is a 50-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of 7 young children who all attend school.  Other children have their own families.  Her husband is a civil servant.  

She is the member of a cafeteria.  She has been involved in this type of income-generating activity for over 10 years.  She has just obtained a fourth loan from Hekima.  She is currently experiencing a drop in her level of activity after having moved her sale outlet from a strategic location to another remote site in the center of town.  With this new loan, she will purchase 2 jars of yoghurt milk and 4 dozen shoes for resale.

Nyirabimana wants to see her children grow in comfortable conditions, she also wants to expand her business and diversify her activities.

She thanks Hakima for its action in favor of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

It is worth noting that in the photo, some mothers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 2 large containers of yogurt and other dairy products

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ok Mufaose Vendors -A Group

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Raphael from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. He is married with two children, one attending school.  Raphael runs an agriculture business selling vegetables. The business has been in operation for 15 years. He says the main challenges faced are storage of perishables. Raphael has requested a loan of $300 to buy vegetables. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to assist in the up-keep of his family. In the future, Raphael plans to open more vegetable outlets throughout the country.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sergelenbat

texts.en: Sergelenbat is a 27-year-old man who lives with his wife and two kids in Uvs Province in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, and his kids are two and one years old. He has been planting vegetables and fruits since 1998, with the help from his father. This has been an experienced business for all those years. Due to the four seasons in Mongolia, he plants once a year.  His aim has always been to supply organic food for local citizens. He has a further plan to plant new types of potatoes in his three hectares of field. Sergelenbat is a hardworking and a bright guy who says, "I would like to continue my business successfully by getting seeds of new potato types and planting them. I wish to supply the best food in the local area." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase the seeds for the business.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is married. He has four children; they all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, and he has a dream to buy a machine that will process the rice well in the future. Besides Gervais, fellow agriculture borrowers were standing near him others behind.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities are affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and support labor costs.

loans.name: Vimbai Group

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Vimbai from Machipisa, a high density suburb in Harare, Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, both attending school. Vimbai runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are too much competition. Vimbai has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of the family. In the future, Vimbai plans to open a clothing factory.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Kuwirirana Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50 year-old Grace from Harare, Zimbabwe. She is married with six children, two attending school. Grace runs a retail business selling clothing. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are client liquidity. Grace has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes and blankets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to assist in the up-keep of her family. In the future, Grace plans to own some shops in other places surrounding the capital city including rural areas.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Thiané

texts.fr: Madame Thiané vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans et s’active depuis un an dans le domaine de la restauration. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de ne pas rester inactive et aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité depuis juillet 2007. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner  en denrées de base pour préparer ses repas et lutter contre l’inflation. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité et d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Thiané lives in Senegal, is 35 years old and has been working in the restauration field for a year. She chose this business so that she would not remain inactive and also to bring in some income. She has been a member of the branch of U-IMCEC in her town since July 2007 and has already repaid two previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to get fresh supplies of basic food products to prepare her meals and to combat inflation. Her aim is to make her business more profitable and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy food products that she needs for her business

loans.name: Rosa Jacqueline

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos menores de edad. Hace más de 03 años que Rosa se dedica a la venta frituras como hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollo broster, etc. la cual los ofrece en las afueras de su casa, está actividad nació con la idea de contar con una negocio propio, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, el dinero que percibe es de mucha ayuda para su familia. Rosa se siente orgullosa pues con su arduo trabajo ha podido ayudar con la educación de sus hijos. A futuro le gustaría poner una tienda donde ofrezca productos de primera necesidad, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio como papas, pollos, hamburguesas, y también comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que comienzan sus clases en el colegio. Rosa agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en: Rosa is an enterprising 31 year old woman who is married and has 4 young children. For more than three years, Rosa has been selling fried food such as hamburgers, salchipapas, roast chicken, etc. She offers them outside her house. This activity started with the idea of having her own business, since this way she can earn more. The money she gets is a lot of help for her family. Rosa is proud because her hard work has helped educate her children. In the future, she would like to open a store where she can offer basic necessity products so she can make more profit. At this time she has asked for the loan to buy materials for her business such as potatoes, chicken, and hamburger, as well as school supplies for her children since they start school soon. Rosa is grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, hamburger and school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Aben Bolainez Picado

texts.es: El emprendedor José Aben, ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en el crédito anterior que solicito fue para abastecerse de producto para el negocio y poder brindarle a sus clientes un excelente servicio. Durante el crédito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio intachable. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasión no es para el negocio, es para su vivienda le quiere realizar alguna remodelación, con el crédito comprara perlines, zinc, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: The entrepreneur José Aben has already worked with Fundación León 2000. With the previous loan he asked for he stocked up on products for his business to be able to offer his customers an excellent service. With the loan he has shown himself to be a responsible person with an impeccable credit history. Right now he is asking for a loan but this time it isn't for his business, but for his home. He wants to do some remodeling. With the loan, he will buy metal beams, zinc sheeting and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy metal beams, zinc sheeting, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Nidia Romo Rocha

texts.es: Nidia dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias porque con su apoyo, puedo seguir adelante:” porque ella recibió un credikiva con el cual compró artículos de la canasta familiar como ranchos, víveres, refrescos etc., con los que surtió su negocio y le fue bien, pues vendió todas las mercancías. En la actualidad  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente artículos de la canasta familiar, como arroz, aceite, granos, víveres y abarrotes. Su experiencia en el negocio y disciplina de trabajo hace que cada vez mas su negocio crezca y la inversión que esta le haga sea exitosa.
texts.en: Nidia says to her Kiva lenders "Thank you very much. Because of your support, I can go ahead" because she received a credikiva with which she bought staples such as snacks, soft drinks, groceries, etc, that she used to supply her business and she was successful, since she has sold all the goods. She is currently applying for another credikiva, which she will use again to buy staples such as rice, oil, grains, supplies and groceries. Her business experience and work ethic are making her business grow further and turning any investment she makes into a success.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, oil, grains, supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is twenty-five years old and runs a pool business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as good because he has many customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to buy another pool table in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a new pool table.

loans.use: To buy a new pool table.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
