She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and also to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: buy chickens, guinea pigs, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Andal Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kadiata Binguiel est la responsable du groupe ANDAL. Elle est célibataire  sans  enfant et  elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des bouteilles de gaz et des pagnes  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne à SODIGAZ pour le gaz et au grand marché pour les pagnes en ville. Ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  20 pièces de pagne et 25 foyers à gaz.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices  et aide à la scolarisation des 02 enfants dont elle a la charge. Mme ambitionne  accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. KADIATA BINGUEL is the head of the group ANDAL. She is single without children but she does have two dependents.

Mrs. Kadiata has been selling bottled gas and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for the past three years. She buys the gas from SODIGAZ and buys the pagnes at the big market in the city. Her customers are friends and neighbors. 

Mrs. Kadiata wants to buy 20 pagnes and 25 bottles of gas.

She saves her profits and provides for the education of the two children she cares for. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 pagnes and 25 bottles of gas.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Since she received her previous loan, Hoa's store now sells a variety of goods and brings in a stable income source to cover all her family expenses and children's school fees.

Hoa plans to use her next loan (17,000,000 VND from CEP) to buy a larger variety of goods such as rice, salted fish and spices to stock in her store. She is confident that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her store.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of goods for her store.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El  comité Sagrada Familia se inicio gracias a la Sra. Etelvina, quien organizo a sus amigas y vecinas para poder formar un grupo.  Actualmente ellas se hallan trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Maria de 62años de edad, ella tiene una despensa, con la cual surte a las personas de su barrio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora y demuestra que con mucho trabajo se puede salir adelante. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesitad, y de esa forma poder tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) committee started thanks to Etelvina who organized her friends and neighbors to form a group.  They are currently working very comfortably within the program and their goal is to reach the maximum level in the program in order to help their families.

One of the group members is María, 62, who has a grocery store that she stocks her people in her neighborhood with.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who proves that with much work one can get ahead.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing to continue helping her family this way.

She asks for the loan to buy basic staple items in order to have a variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ciriaca Paulina

texts.es:
Ciriaca es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 04 hijos, cuenta con educación  primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para para la confección de pantalones  de lana, la mercadería lo vende en la plaza de san José y sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como chofer (transportista).
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y tener una tienda por el centro. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro y su ganancia
texts.en:
Ciriaca is a member of Las Mensajeras (The Messengers) Community Bank, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She has studied through primary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. She shares that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and the money helped her increase her business capital. She is asking for a new loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She will use the money to make wool pants. She sells her merchandise in the plaza of San José and her children help her with the business. Her husband works in transportation as a driver.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and have a store downtown. What she most likes about her community bank are the savings and her earnings.

loans.use: buy 10 kilos of different colored wool

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has two children. As a single parent, she must feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees .

Ama sells maize and plantains at Frami near Elmina and Kakum National Park, which she has done for five years. Ama will use her loan of 800 GHS fron CRAN to buy more bags of maize and plantains to sell. With increased profits, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and plantains to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a baker. She bakes meat pies for sale and has done this for two years now. 

Nana lives together with her husband and four children at Frami. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Nana will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and meat for her bakery. With the new profit, Nana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and meat for her bakery.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 51 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además tiene animales, pollos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas insumos, fertilizantes, líquidos. con el crèdito podrá salvar los cultivos de papas y maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. 

Con la ayuda del crédito anterior le ha ayudado mucho para sobresalir y tener nuevos ingresos para el bienestar de la familia.

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y las plagas en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, jugar con los sobrinos el carnaval.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 51, is single and has a son; she lives in Guaranda Province in Bolívar.

The “Emmanuel” communal bank has 12 members.  This communal bank is 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.

María is a farmer growing potatoes and corn; she also has animals, chickens and cattle.

She requests the loan to buy manure, seeds, supplies, fertilizer and liquids.  With the loan she will be able to save her potato and corn crops.  Her purchases and sales take place weekly in Guaranda.

The previous loan helped her quite a bit to get ahead and earn new income for her family’s wellbeing.

Her dream is to be able to have a vehicle of her own.  The challenges she faces are transportation and crop infestations.  In her free time she likes to rest, play with her nephews and carnival.

loans.use: to buy manur, seed, supplies, fertilizer and liquids.

loans.name: San Arnoldo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Arnoldo está en el tercer ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 12 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda mutua.
María es una mujer muy trabajadora, nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, y que siempre termina ya muy noche. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, la cual le ayuda a mantener a su familia y a cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Ella se ha acercado a la fundación paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual quiere surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Arnoldo Committee is in its 3rd loan cycle. The Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya (Women’s Committee of the Paraguayan Foundation) has 12 members who work in a mutually supportive and cooperative environment.

Maria is a hard-working individual who tells us that she works very early in the morning until very late at night. She has a well-stocked store that helps her support her family and cover the day-to-day costs.

She became a member of the Paraguayan Foundation to request a loan, which she will use to buy basic, everyday supplies to further stock up her store.

loans.use: buy supplies to further stock up her store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  She is married with seven children. 

Pacita has a longanisa (sausage) and dried fish business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has a requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more longanisa and dried fish.  Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 

Gemma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her fish vending business.  Gemma has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Amen Group

texts.en:
John is 42 years old. He is married and has four children. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, etc.  He also drives a taxi.  

John deems it a big opportunity to expand his business by including other items frequently demanded by customers. He wants to use this loan to purchase more stock to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve sales to enable him to save more for his children’s education, open a supermarket and also buy a new taxi. 

John belongs to the community group called Amen Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock his grocery store

loans.name: Soda Yahda Group

texts.en:
Ayeshetu is thirty years old. She lives in a rented apartment with her husband, who is a welder, and her child who is currently in school. She trades in maize and soya beans in the local market of Takoradi.  Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and soya beans to grow her business and scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support her child’s education. 

Ayeshetu belongs to the community group called Soda Yahda Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and soya beans

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo Para el Futuro 1, 2 & 3 (Growing for the Future). Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She is a single young mother with a child who is working hard to pay her university fees and become a  professional -- this is her most important challenge.  She also wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house.

Having repaid her previous loans and grown her business, Adriana is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around five years, cooking food and delivering it to people. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a freezer and more goods like rice and beans. She will use the additional profits to save and supply some of the needs for her only child and for her home. In the near future, she wants to build her own house.

Adriana is dreaming to become professional and to have a successful business. This Esperanza associate began with us to access loans for her business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy a freezer and food ingredients

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 56 years old and lives in Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married and has three children. 

Evelyn has an Avon and personal collection dealer business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional Avon and personal collection products to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to earn money for her future and for her children.

loans.use: buy Avon and personal products

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is 44 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has six children. 

Diego has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
 
Diego has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, he hopes to have a fishing boat and earn money for his children and for their future.  Diego is a hardworking, honest and business-minded person.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Romer

texts.en:
Romer is 37 years old and lives in Lawa-an, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is single. 

Romer has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase feeds for hog fattening. 

Romer has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 21 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, actividad que realizaba desde cuando estudiaba en su bachillerato y vendía revistas, dulce y todo lo que sus compañeras de colegio le podían comprar. Gradualmente cuando pasó a otra edad y entendió como posibilidad de generar ingresos el comercio,  se dedicó a el agregando muchas mas mercancías a su oferta, mediante guías especializadas, así  inició su tarea de captar clientes. Hoy es un negocio con el cual ayuda al desempeño de su hogar, porque vendiendo productos de belleza y ropa, ha logrado estudiar y a responder  a sus gastos personales desde hace 6 años. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es lograr  ingresos suficientes, para atender a su clientela, especialmente cuando las revistas o catálogos traen descuentos especiales, Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado que es una línea que en la actualidad no vende y que aumentará su clientela. Esta es justamente la razón de que su inversión terminará siendo muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Cindy is 21 years old. She lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. She sells a variety of merchandise. and has been doing this work since the the time she was studying for her high school diploma, and was selling magazines, candy, and everything her fellow students were able to buy from her. 

Gradually, as she moved forward in life, she realized she could generate income through business, and worked to add many more products to the merchandise she sold, by using specialized guides. This is how she began her work of attracting customers. 

Today it is a business through which she helps supports the functioning of her household. Because by selling beauty products and clothing, she has managed to go to school and deal with her personal expenses for six years. 

Currently, her greatest challenge is to achieve enough income to serve her customers, especially when the magazines or catalogs offer special discounts. 

This is the reason why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing and footwear: a line of products she currently doesn't sell, and that will increase her clientele. This is exactly why her investment will end up being very successful.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”. It’s located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Irene is a 56-year-old married mother of 5 children. This member alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. Maria sells rice, sugar, milk, cookies and oil. She works from 6am to 10pm. With this business, she is able to get ahead with her children. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. Maria is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale prices to stock her store.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale prices to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca tiene 27 años de edad es divorciada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el hijo menor en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
María se dedica a ala agricultura a la siembra de papas, hortalizas y legumbres, cebolla, acelga, además cría animales como los pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, urea, abonos orgánicos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá fumigar a tiempo los cultivos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  Guaranda cada 15 días y tiempo de cosecha.
El sueño es poder tener una casa que sea propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el transporte y los intermediarios.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca is a 27-year-old, divorced, mother of 3 children. She lives with her youngest child in Guaranda, a canton in the province of Bolivar.

The village bank, VRC Grupo Emmanuel, has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in the district of San Juan de Llullundongo, a precint of Guaranda.

Maria is an agricultural and livestock farmer and grows potatoes, vegetables and legumes, onions, chard and also breeds pigs and chickens.

She is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizer, urea and organic manure. With the help of this loan, she’ll be able to fumigate the crops on time. She buys and sells in Guaranda every 15 days and during the harvest.

She dreams of owning a house. The obstacles she faces include transportation and middle men.

On her time off, she enjoys relaxing and enjoying the festivities at the carnival.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, urea and organic manure.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental where she is engaged in motor vehicle repair, earning approximately PHP 5,200.00 each month.

A member of PMPC for three years, Mary Jane is requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase equipment for her motor vehicle repair business. In the future, she hopes to buy additional units of motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motor vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Tynarkul

texts.ru:
Тынаркул 54 года. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Тынаркул занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза с 23,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Тынаркул две дойные коровы, две головы бычков и три лошади, а также 1,40 га земли с зерновыми культурами.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тынаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Тынаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Tynarkul is 54 years old. As a source of income for her family, Tynarkul is engaged in animal husbandry and field crop cultivation. Started back in the period of the Soviet Union with 23,000 som (KGS), the farm currently brings in around 11,000 com (KGS) per month. Today Tynarkul has two milk cows, two bulls and three horses at the farm, and further 1,40 hectares of land with crops. 

With aim to further develop her business, Tynarkul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bulls for fattening and reselling. The income Tynarkul plans to invest in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase bulls for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. María  tiene 58 años y es viuda con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  21-14- 12 y 10 años se dedica a la actividad de  repostería en masitas (empanadas, queques, alfajores y salteñas), su negocio esta ubicado en la zona de  Pasankeri, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de un horno industrial  para su negocio,  razón para solicitar este préstamo es para equipar mejor su negocio, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar la venta de sus productos en distintos mercados y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar su equipo de producción, su deseo es poder tener su casita propia, razón por la cual trabaja y esfuerza mucho.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 58 years old and a widow with 4 children, who are 21, 14, 12 and 10 years old. She has a pastry making business (turnovers, cakes, sandwich cookies and meat pies).  Her business is located in the Pasankeri area. This loan is her first cycle within the institution. 

Maria will use the loan to purchase an industrial oven for her business. Her reason for applying for the loan is to better equip her business. She confronts challenges in her business, which are to increase the sales of her products in different markets and she will use the profits to expand her production team.

Her desire is to have her own little house. This is the reason why she works so hard and puts forth so much effort.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven.

loans.name: Elena Rita

texts.es: La Sra. Elena tiene 46 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 24 y 18 años que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, se dedica a la venta de regalos y adornos su tienda se encuentran en una zona muy estratégica de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Elena utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de un exhibidor para exponer sus productos y aumento de capital para su negocio, La Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y alza de precios. Y los  beneficios los reinvertirá en su negoció, la Sra. Elena se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elena, 46, isn’t married but is a single mother of two children who are 24 and 18 years of age and who are studying in the university.  She sells gifts and decorations.  Her store is located in a very strategic spot in the city of Cochabamba.  

This loan is her first cycle within the institution.  Elena will use this loan to buy a display case to display her products and to increase capital for her business.  The challenge she faces in her business is competition and rising prices.  She will reinvest profits in the business.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to increase working capital.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora  Martha es cliente nueva que esta en su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  vive en la ciudad de La Paz tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, la cliente se dedica  a la venta de chamarras y chalecos en la frontera con el país de Argentina,  el crédito lo destinara  para  la compra de chalecos por mayor, ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar y de esta manera satisfacer  a sus clientes, la Sra. Martha realiza viajes a distintos lugares a ofrecer sus productos, pero ya tiene mas clientela en la frontera, aun a si se sigue abriendo mercado, es una mujer joven y emprendedora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Martha is a new client who is in her first loan cycle with the institution.  She lives in the city of La Paz and has two school-age children.  She works selling jackets on the border with Argentina.  She will use the loan to buy vests wholesale.  In this way she will satisfy her customers because she has many orders for vests.

Martha travels to different places to sell her products, but she has more customers on the border.  Even so she continues opening up her market.  She is a young and enterprising woman.  She is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vests

loans.name: Doris Avigail

texts.es: La Sra. Doris tiene 37 años no es casada pero convive  con su pareja, tienen dos hijos que son de las edades de  2 y 3 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de edredones por la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí, la Sra. Doris es cliente antigua de la institución ya que este préstamo es su novena secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Doris utilizara este préstamo  para compra de edredones y pinturas  Para  su negocio, La Sra. Doris enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios del crédito mejorando la atención y diversificando sus productos. La Sra. Doris  sueña con crecer mas en su negocio, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad se vida se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Doris is 37 years old and unmarried but lives with her partner. They have two children who are 2 and 3 years old. She sells comforters in Villa Nueva Potosí. Doris is a longtime client of the institution, and this loan is her ninth loan cycle. Doris will use this loan to buy comforters and paintings for her business. Competition is a challenge Doris confronts in her business, and she will use the proceeds from the loan to improve service and diversify her products.

Doris dreams of growing her business, increasing her income, and finally, improving her quality of life. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it offers.

loans.use: to buy comforters and paintings

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, la socia vende panes y pasteles en su panadería, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los panes y pasteles como harina, azúcar, mantequilla y huevos al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" communal bank, located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province in Cusco department.

She is 31, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her bakery business. She sells breads and pastries in her bakery, and works from 6:00am to 7:00pm. By means of this business, she is raising her children. Her dream is to expand her bakery business. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy ingredients at wholesale for preparing breads and pastries, such as flour, sugar, butter and eggs.

The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy at wholesale, ingredients for making breads and pastries, such as flour, sugar, butter and eggs.

loans.name: Edna May

texts.en:
Edna May is 34 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Edna May works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase a fishing boat and fishing net for her fish-selling business. 

Edna May has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and fishing net for her fish-selling business

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is married with three children. She is 38 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Mildred has a hog-fattening business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 1,600. Mildred has been a member of PMPC for one year.

In the future, Mildred hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.  Mildred is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hog raising

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 43 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Celerina works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more dried fish to sell. 

Celerina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Celerina hopes to build a stall for her dried-fish-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is a young and dynamic entrepreneur from the Dominican Republic and has been working hard ever since arriving in the United States to be a productive citizen. Before moving she gathered a wealth of experience in childcare and looked to put this experience towards her ultimate goal of running her own business. 

Currently, she is the owner of a group family daycare facility in the Grand Concourse area of the Bronx. She gets most of her referrals through an agency and has a capacity of 14 children at once. She also employs one full-time employee. She is looking for a loan to better prepare for the children at her daycare facility. She would like to purchase new computers, books, and toys for the children to use while at the facility, and also child-sized furniture to create a more comfortable atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase new books, toys, computers, and furniture

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is married with four children. He is 50 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vicente is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for his farm. 

Vicente became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Vicente hopes to purchase an additional parcel of rice land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
Gary is a retired Army veteran who came out of the service with a great understanding of various aspects of the Army, as well as an entrepreneurial desire. While in the service he noticed that many of the products that were being used were poorly made and sold to the Army for very high prices. He decided that he could help the Army by building quality, durable products that could be purchased much cheaper than from the current production facilities. 

Gary decided to follow up on this endeavor by founding his own enterprise. His greatest success came with the development of the BiCon, a military suited shower/latrine facility, in 2009. In 2010, he had planned to seriously market this product; however, his plans were halted when he was sent to travel  internationally for long spans with his full-time job. For the next two years he only had the opportunity to push his smaller, less significant products. 

Gary is determined to start selling the BiCon in 2012. He is asking for a loan to help him actively sell the BiCon through traveling to different trade shows and starting a marketing campaign. He now employs two other workers.

loans.use: to attend trade shows and market his new BiCon product

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hardworking, married man living with his six children in Hioma, Uganda.

To earn a living, he is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a teenager. His primary business challenges are price fluctuations and high fuel and transportation costs. He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds and to pay labor expenses.

His goals for his family are to educate his children and to a build a permanent house. His business-related dream is to diversify his business and to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 37-year-old, married man with three children.

To earn a living, Julius works as a farmer. He has been farming for quite a long time. His primary business challenges are seasonality and price fluctuations. Julius is seeking a loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

His goals for his family are to educate his children and to buy a car. He also wishes to expand his business to new markets and to diversify his business operations to include animal rearing.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 32-year-old, married man with four children.

To earn a living, he works as a farmer. He has been farming for over three years. His primary business challenges are seasonality and insufficient capital. He is seeking a loan to pay for farm labor.

His goals for his family are to educate his children and to build a permanent house. His business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to pay farm labor costs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 29 years old and married with one child. She owns a retail shop that she started by using capital given to her by her family members. She faces challenges of high taxes and customers who don't pay on time. Her family goal is to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. She intends to use the loan to buy goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Wadah

texts.en:
Wadah, a 32-year-old, is a computer engineer who has  a great desire to progress. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

The activity that he carries out is advertising for many stores.  He very politely attends to his clients who are mostly his friends. He started his business by renting a computer at home for designing advertisement panels for stores. He considers it a profitable business because of the profit that it earns which permits him to maintain his family and to reinvest in his business, as well as the reception that his products continue to have. 

Wadah decided to begin his business because he needed work and to have an income to maintain his family. In the future he wants to become a employee in a great company in addition to this business in order to help his family . For this and seeing the results that he continues to have, he desires to enlarge his stock of products and to see his business grow. So, Wadah requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy panels and other advertising items. 

In the future, Wadah hopes that his business will increase its sales considerably. He also hopes that it will keep generating the income he needs to maintain his household as well as hoping to get a job in a good company.

loans.use: to buy panels and other advertising items for his business.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is 27 years old, married with one child, living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a farmer and he acquired land from his father. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His personal goal is to go back to school and his business goal is to buy  more land for crop growing. Hannington intends to use the loan facility to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 34-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop which she started four years ago, starting with capital worth 500,000 shillings and now the business is worth 1,500,000 shillings. She faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her dream is educating her children and buying land to grow crops. Jane needs this loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence wants a loan to buy  a pool table for his bar. He started his bar business on a small scale and has now grown. He lives  in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 35 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his two children and wife. Unstable electricity and competition are his major challenges. He desires to educate his children, build a permanent home, and do farming.

loans.use: to buy a pool table

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to buy sodas, sugar, salt and rice to sell. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 30 and married with three children. He runs a retail shop and has been in business for ten years. His dream is to educate his children and grow his business to wholesale.

loans.use: buy sodas, sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 51-year-old single parent living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a restaurant that she started ten years back. She started by selling only tea and later advanced to selling food also. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation of food prices and also the increasing prices of charcoal and firewood plus high rental charges.

Aisha's dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home, buy a plot in Kamwenge, hire employees to help expand her business and move to a more permanent location. She needs the loan to pay rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to pay rent for her business premises.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a hardworking, single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a used clothing business, which she has been doing for four years now. Her primary business challenge is a lack of capital; as a result, she is unable to satisfy all of her customers' needs. She is seeking a loan to buy additional clothes for re-sale purposes.

Her family goal is to educate her children and to build a permanent house. She dreams of expanding her business to new markets.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 38-year-old single woman with two children living in Hioma, Uganda.

She is a hardworking businesswoman. Specifically, she runs a drug shop, which she has been doing for over six years. Her primary business challenges are customers who do not pay on time and seasonal variations. Winfred is seeking a loan to buy more drugs for re-sale purposes.

She hopes to avoid renting in the future by building a permanent family house and to educate her children. Her business goal is to expand to new markets.

loans.use: to purchase additional drugs to re-sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 24 years old and married with one child living in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a retail shop, which she has been running for three years. She faces the challenge of customers not paying on time. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. She intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Asasira

texts.en: Asasira is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is hardworking and she has a business selling second hand clothes, which she has been running for over three years. She started with a small amount of capital given to her by her husband and later supplemented it with a loan from HOFOKAM. She has challenges of customers not paying on time and some not paying at all. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Asasira needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been operating a wholesale shop selling beer for 15 years now. He started his business with 200,000 shillings but now it's worth 6,000,000 shillings. Though he has progressed, his challenges have been price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal customers. His dream is educating his children and expanding his business into new markets. John needs this loan to buy more beer for resale.

loans.use: to buy more beer to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a garage that he started seven years back with capital worth 300,000 shillings and now it's worth 2 million shillings. In spite of his progress, he is challenged by customers not paying on time and high taxes levied on him for his services. His dream is educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Peter needs the loan to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Yoronimu

texts.en: Yoronimu lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 34 years old and married with four children. He does farming and specializes in maize growing. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business. Price fluctuations and seasonal weather hinder his business. He wants a loan to buy maize to plant.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh's previous loan enabled her to increase the sales from her cafe and earn a higher income to support her family. Anh is now requesting a 20,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy new furniture and cooking appliances for her cafe.

Anh hopes that these improvements will help her attract new customers. She also hopes that with the help of this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and cooking appliances for her cafe.

loans.name: Karomatkhon

texts.ru: Кароматхон замужем и любящая мать двоих детей, сыну 21 лет а дочке 19 лет. Она очень старательная и воспитанная женщина, которая занимается продажей кондитерских изделий в своем городе. Закупает товар в частных цехах каждую неделю. Она в этом бизнесе уже более 9 лет и имеет богатый опыт.  Кароматхон запрашивает займ для покупки кондитерских изделий.
texts.en: Karomatkhon is married and a loving mother of two children - a 21-year-old son and a 19-year-old daughter. Karomatkhon is a very diligent and courteous woman who sells confectionery in her city. Each week, she purchases her products from privately-owned production facilities. She has been in this business for over 9 years and has extensive experience. Karomatkhon is requesting this loan to purchase confectionery products.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudió hasta primero de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de estructuras metálicas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materiales: 100 planchas, fierro para la fabricación de puertas y ventanas, etc. Recibe el apoyo de su esposo.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es agrandar su negocio y tener una ferretería bien abastecida.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” Communal Bank, located in the district of  Juliaca in San Román Province and Puno Department. She is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She attended primary school through the first grade.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years and notes that her first loan was for S/. 300, money that increased the capital of her business selling metallic structures.  

Bertha is applying for a new loan in the amount of S/.1,200, money that she will invest in purchasing the following material: 100 pieces of wrought iron to make doors and windows, etc. She has her husband’s support.

Her dream for the future is to expand her business and have a well stocked hardware store.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the interest on her savings account.

loans.use: to buy 100 pieces of wrought iron.

loans.name: Tondouman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques les six femmes du groupe  Tondouman ont  en moyenne 40 ans et 6 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Beni dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font l’achat et la vente de savon, de pâte d’arachide, de riz et des jus locaux. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Fatoumata (assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  pâte d’arachide dans le village de Beni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de grains d’arachide à la foire de Cinzana Gare qui sera transformé en pâte d’arachide.
Pour faire de la pâte d’arachide, on trie d’abord les meilleurs grains, les grilles,  les décortique, les débarrasse  de ses sons et les broie. La pâte ainsi obtenue est revendue en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de 1ère nécessité. Madame   Fatoumata a pour ambition de faire l’achat des petits ruminants dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six members of the Tondouman group are married women mostly living in polygamous families.  They are 40 years old on average and have an average of six children each.  They all live in the village of Beni in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighborhood, family and marriage connections, and through their business activities in the village.  They buy and sell soap, peanut paste, rice, and local juices.  With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first cooperative loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (seated at center in the photo) sells peanut paste in the village of Beni and the surrounding area.  She plans to use her loan to buy a bag of peanuts in the Cinzana Gare market, which she will make into peanut paste.  To make peanut paste, the best peanuts must first be separated, then roasted and peeled.  After removing the skins, the peanuts are ground.  The resulting paste is sold on a retail basis for cash or credit to a customer base made up mainly of women.  With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and take care of urgent household expenses.  Mrs. Fatoumata also hopes to buy some small livestock through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND from CEP to buy a greater quantity of food to stock her general store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her store and earn a higher income to help her support her family. She feels purchasing this food will help her to better meet demand from her customers.

Chau hopes that her new loan will assist her to attract new customers and increase her sales. This will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of food to stock her general store.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a 48-year-old married woman with five children aged between eleven and 21 years old. Her husband works as a fisherman. A priority of hers is her children's education.

Angeles does her best to contribute to her family's earnings. She and her husband work hand in hand to keep their fishing business running. She has been involved in the business for the past five years.

Angeles is planning to use her 6,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy fishing nets, hooks and other gear. She hopes this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other gear.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 40 лет, замужем, имеет трех детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Анар занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2010 году с покупки четырех коров хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодня хозяйство Анар насчитывает 1 корову, 1 теленка, 1 лошадь, 5 овец и 2 козы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Anar is 40 years old, married, and has three children. To provide for her family, Anar raises livestock. Her business, started in 2010 with a purchase of four cows, now earns her roughly 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. Anar's farm currently has 1 cow, 1 calf, 1 horse, 5 sheep and 2 goats. In order to continue expanding her business, Anar has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening and subsequent resale. Anar plans to invest her profits into additional livestock purchases.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Более 15 лет Сабоат занимается разведением скота. Она очень трудолюбивая замужняя женщина, которая имеет одного сына. Её сын уже взрослый и помогает в содержании семьи. Сабоат занимается разведением скота у себя дома, также имеет хорошие условие для них. Является собственником бизнеса. Сабоат запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Saboat has been raising cattle for over 15 years. She is a very hard-working married woman and has one adult son who helps the family. Saboat raises animals at home and keeps them in good living conditions. She alone owns her business. Saboat is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase cattle and expand her business. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Delia Roxana

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, cuenta con educación secundaria.
 
La señora Delia es socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de animales y productos de la región, solicita un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizara para comprar animales para su engorde,  en el negocio trabaja junto con sus padres.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir estudiando.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Delia is a member of “Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II” Communal Bank located in Arapa District, in Azángaro Province and Puno Department. She is 19, single and has no children. She has a secondary education.

Delia is a new member who recently joined to work with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She sells animals and regional products. She is applying for a loan in the amount of S/. 500, money that she will use to buy animals to fatten. She and her parents work together in the business.

Her dream for the future is to continue her studies.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel Angel is requesting a loan to purchase corrugated iron to make a new roof for his house.  He has been working with Asociacón Arariwa for three years, and earns a living as a taxi driver in Cusco.  He just bought his own car in the past year.  Prior to that, he rented a vehicle.  His typical work day starts at 8 a.m. and ends at 8 p.m.  Miguel Angel is 45 years old and has three children who are 14, 17, and 20 years old.  One day he hopes to own his own business specializing in craft work.

Miguel Angel is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: buy materials to build a new roof for his house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 35 years old and is raising a 1-year-old with her partner. She works as an administrative assistant in an office, typically starting at 8 a.m. in the morning and ending at 7 p.m. in the evening. 

She is requesting a loan in order to invest in a new business selling shoes. She hopes that she will be able to afford her own storefront one day.

Elsa is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur,” which is receiving its sixteenth loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy shoes for a new business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been running a printing house from a rented shop for about 15 years.  She can produce all types of printed materials for her customers, including flyers, brochures and books.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as paper, cardboard and ink.  In the future, she would also like to invest in an offset machine and a numbering machine.  Elizabeth is 41 years old and married with two children ages 11 and 13.

Elizabeth is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her printing business.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is 32 years old and owns a shop where he sells and repairs computers.  He has had this shop for about four years, and said that his background in computer science and systems engineering inspired him to start this business.  He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, including computers, accessories, and other supplies.  His dream is to grow his business, move to a larger storefront, and start offering his services to state entities.

Milton is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his computer store.

loans.name: Carminia

texts.en:
Carminia is 29 years old and married with two children who are five and eight years old.  She has been running a small grocery store in a rented location for about three years, and is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta and milk.  Her dream is to eventually open a hardware supply store in her house.

Carminia is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 34 years old and has been working as a florist most of her life. She has two children, ages 9 and 13, and lives with her partner. She rents a shop in Cusco where she sells flowers and creates arrangements for special occasions such as baptisms and weddings. Her arrangements include carnations, gladiolas, roses, and any number of other flowers from Urubamba, Lima, and elsewhere in Peru. 

Maria Elena is requesting a loan in order to purchase flowers for her business. Her dream is to own a large storefront where she can display and sell her floral creations.

Maria Elena is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: buy flowers

loans.name: Braulio Luis

texts.en:
Braulio Luis is 33 years old and is raising two children, ages 4 and 10, with his partner. He is a supervisor of cleaning personnel at a company where he has worked for 11 years. 

Braulio Luis is requesting a loan in order to build up savings as well as to purchase necessities such as school supplies for his children. His desire is to continue developing his abilities at work and to save enough money to buy a house for his family.

Braulio Luis is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: build up savings and buy school supplies for his children

loans.name: Dora Yanet

texts.en:
Dora Yanet is 47 years old and divorced.  She has two children, ages 14 and 19.  She runs an informal business knitting and selling sweaters, although her primary income is from an administrative position at a government office which she has held for about 20 years. 

At this time, Dora Yanet is thinking of formally launching her sweater business and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more wool. She would eventually like to own a store where she can sell her hand-knit garments.

Dora Yanet is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase wool to knit sweaters

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has been a public accountant since he graduated from college over 25 years ago. He is 55 years old and married with three children who are 7, 14, and 23 years old. 

Victor is requesting a loan in order to implement his business, specifically to purchase computers for his office’s computing center. His dream is to expand his establishment and begin offering financial auditing services in the future.

Victor is a member of the village bank “Cusco Sur” which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: buy computers

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El socio Alberto continua con su pequeño taller de carpintería de forma alquilada, el no tiene una casa ni terreno propio asi que sigue alquilando el espacio que es una especie de cochera acomodada para poner sus maquinas y algunos trabajos realizados, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de madera, esmalte.
texts.en: Alberto continues working with his small, rented carpentry shop.  He does not have a house or own land so he continues to rent the space, which is a type of garage customized to put in his machinery and had some other work done.  Alberto is a very hard worker and he wants the loan to invest in the purchase of wood and enamel.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and enamel.

loans.name: Lily  Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lily Pilar; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, ella hace teñidos, cortes de cabello, ondulaciones entre otros trabajos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su salón de belleza como tijeras, tintes, liquidos para ondulación y sillas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Lily Pilar belongs to the “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

 Lily Pilar is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She has a beauty salon business and provides tints, haircuts and hair waving and curling, among other services. She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. The business has enabled her to move her children forward. Her dream is to expand her beauty shop business. She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as scissors, tints, waving liquid and chairs.

Lily Pilar is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as scissors, tints, waving liquid and chairs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
36-year-old Josephine is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has four children aged between five and sixteen.  Josephine is engaged in a fishing business.  Her husband, who is a fisherman, uses their fishing boat to catch fish.  Josephine sells her husband's catch at their local town market.  She also sells fresh fruit to her community.  

Josephine works hard to help sustain her family.  She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials.  With any additional income Josephine hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
26-year-old Marilyn earns a living by selling fish to her community.  She is a married woman with three children aged two, four and eight. Her husband is also a fish vendor.

Marilyn has been selling fish for five years.  She is able to help her husband buy their family's basic needs with what she earns.  Marilyn plans to use her loan to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, Marilyn hopes to earn more and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos en estudio.  Solo estudió hasta 2do de primaria.
 
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.
	
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar veinte unidades de ovinos, nos cuenta que los compra en Arapa, Juliaca, Taraco y Chupa, a veces su esposo le ayuda con el negocio ya que trabaja en la mina.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener más capital y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, el ahorro y las charlas.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a member of the “Las Mujeres de Santa rosa de Arapa II” communal bank located in Arapa District, Azángano Province and Puno Department.  She’s 35 years old, married and has four children attending school.  She only studied second grade in elementary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her business of selling livestock.

She will now request a new loan in the amount of 2000 new soles to buy twenty sheep.  She tells us that she buys in Arapa, Juliaca, Taraco and Chupa  and sometimes her husband helps her with the business since he works in the mine.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to improve the business.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the punctuality, the savings and the chats.

loans.use: to buy twenty sheep.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es:
Escolástica es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos (5 independientes), también tiene a su cargo una nieta que vive con ella. La señora no tiene estudios.
 	
Desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para compra cuatro ovejas, también se dedican a la venta de productos nativos y venta de leche.

Ahora solicitarán un nuevo préstamo por las suma de  S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de chanchitos y toritos para su engorde por tres meses, nos cuenta que los compra y vende en la localidad de Taraco, ella trabaja junto con su esposo, quien también trabaja como veterinario.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener ganados mejorados.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Escolástica is a member of the Communal Bank, "Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II (The Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II)" located in the district of Arapa,province of Azangaro and department of Puno.  She is 60 years old and married with six children (five of whom are independent).   She is also responsible for a granddaughter who lives with her.  Escolástica did not attend school.
 
For a cycle working with Manuela Ramos, her first loan was in the amount of S /. 500.00 new soles, which she used to buy four sheep.  Escolástica is also involved in selling native products and milk.

Now Escolástica is seeking a new loan for the sum of S /. 800.00 new soles to invest in the purchase of pigs and bulls to fatten for three months.  Escolástica  tells us that she buys and sells in the town of Taraco.  She works with her husband, who also works as a veterinarian.

Escolástica's dream for the future is to have improved earnings.  What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and bulls.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La Sra. Dora tiene 58 años de edad,  es casada con hijos ya independientes, ella se decida a la repostería, elabora todo tipo de galletas empanadas y queques, su negocio se encuentran en su mismo domicilio, la Sra. Dora es clienta antigua de la institución ya que se encuentra en su vigésima secuencia, este préstamo La Sra. Dora lo utilizara para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción del piso de su cocina, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es que es época de lluvias el piso se remoja y es un inconveniente para ella trabajar en esas condiciones,  Dora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de panaderías grandes, y   utilizara los beneficios para  reinvertirlo en su negocio. La Sra. Dora sueña seguir trabajando para mejorar su casa y así tener mayor comodidad, se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dora, 58, is married and has children who are already independent.  She is a pastry chef making all types of cookies, turnovers and cakes.  Her business is located at her house.  

Dora is a longstanding client of the institution since she’s in her 20th cycle.  Dora will use this loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair her kitchen floor.  The reason for asking for the loan is that during the rainy season the floor bets wet and it’s inconvenient to work under these conditions.  

The challenge Dora faces in her business is competition from large bakeries.  She uses profits to reinvest in her business.  Dora dreams with continuing to work in order to do some home improvements to have more comfort.  She feels very happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to repair the floor.

loans.name: Éctor

texts.es: Ector, de oficio agricultor dice que este crédito ha resultado muy positivo y beneficioso para su negocio y familia. Pues le ha permitido comprar insumos , fertilizantes para sembrar granos básico en especial maíz ya que está en la temporada en que la demanda de granos básicos es muy solicitada por la población y el crédito le ha ayudado a tener invertir y vender en especial  frijoles, está muy agradecido por la confianza depositada  departe de los prestamistas de Kiva. Hoy siempre con el deseo de salir adelante y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para salir adelante con su familia requiere este crédito para comprar 32 quintales de maíz. Este Crédito le ayudara a adquirir una buena cantidad de maíz y almacenarlo para venderlo durante el tiempo en que comienza a escasear este producto  y conseguir un buen precio de esta manera su clientela tendrá el maíz que necesita.
texts.en:
Ector is a farmer; he says that the loan has turned out to be very positive and beneficial for his business and his family because it’s made it possible for him to buy supplies and fertilizer to plant basic grains, especially corn, since this is the season when basic grains are in high demand by the population and the loan has helped him invest and sell beans especially.  He is very grateful for the trust placed in him by Kiva lenders.   

Always wanting to get ahead and continuing to invest in his business to get ahead with his family, he needs this loan to buy 32 quintals of corn.  This loan will help him acquire a good quantity of corn to store and then sell when it starts to become scarce thus getting a good price while his customers will get the corn they need.

loans.use: to buy 32 quintals of corn.

loans.name: Nancy Beatriz

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. La señora estudió hasta 1ro de secundaria.
 
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales vacunos y ovinos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar un camión de forraje para los animales, trabaja junto con su esposo quién también trabaja en electrificación.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II communal bank.  It is located in the Arapa district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  Nancy, age 24, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She attended school until the first year of high school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to invest in her business of selling cows and sheep.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles to buy a truckload of fodder for the animals.  She works together with her husband, and he also works as an electrician.

Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store.

What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings and the easy terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo tiene 30 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Emmanuel está conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Angel se dedica a ala agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría pollos, cerdos, ganado.
Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico, urea, líquidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los fertilizantes para trabajar en los cultivos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente y en tiempo de cosecha.
El sueño es poder tener un vehículo que sea propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los intermediarios.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.

El CREDITO ANTERIOR ha sido muy bueno porque ha podido comprar los fertilizantes, semillas y esta "muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada, oportuna y que no se olviden nunca de apoyarles".
texts.en:
Ángel Segundo, 30, is married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda Province in Bolívar. 

The “Emmanuel”  communal bank has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.

Ángel is a potato and corn farmer and also raises chickens, pigs and cattle.  He requests the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, organic manure, urea and liquids to kill bugs.  With help from the loan he will be able to acquire the fertilizers to work his crops.  His sales and purchases take place in Guaranda weekly and during harvest time.

His dream is to have a vehicle of his own.  The challenge he faces is dealing with middlemen.  In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball and enjoying  Carnival season.

The previous loan has been very good because he has been able to buy fertilizer and seed and he is “very grateful for the timely support provided; please don’t ever forget to support them.”

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, organic manure, urea and bug killers.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: La socia Yanet; continua con el negocio de venta de comida caseras y tambien ella vende por catalogo perfumes, cremas, labiales entre otros productos de belleza, la socia  tambien desea invertir en esta ocasion en la compra de articulos de limpieza y venderlos, ella en esta ocasion hara la prueba de establecer un nuevo negocio con la venta de productos de limpieza y de comprar productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas en oferta.
texts.en: Yanet continues selling home-cooked meals and also perfume, cream and lipstick, among other beauty products, via catalogue.  She also wants to invest in cleaning supplies to sell this time around.  On this occasion she’ll attempt to set up a new business selling cleaning supplies and will buy beauty products like cologne, perfume and cream that are on special.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase the sales from her butcher stall and earn a higher income to support her family. Mai would now like to request another loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of meat to sell. She hopes that this will permit her to attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in her current business by purchasing more meat for resale

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 53 years old and is a married woman with a 20-year-old child. Her husband works as a fisherman. Melecia is also engaged in fishing. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys more fish from other fishermen to sell. Aside from fish, Melecia also sells fruits.

Melecia has requested a loan to buy fishing materials such as fish nets, hooks and baits. She hopes for the fishing business to be successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fish nets, hooks and baits

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy would like to take out another loan in order to buy buy sewing tools, equipment, and materials. Vy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She is confident that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, allowing her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools and materials

loans.name: Gisella Teresa

texts.es:
Gisella es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con una hija, con estudios secundarios.
 
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses.

Solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/, 800.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizara para comprar 15 cajas de gaseosas de diferentes tamaños, en el negocio trabaja sola, su esposos trabaja en la mina.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una distribuidora.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Gisella’s a member of the “Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II” communal bank located in Arapa District, Azángano Province and Puno Department.  She’s 22 years old and has a spouse and a daughter.  She attended secondary education.

Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her grocery business.  She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 6 months.  She will request a new loan in the amount of 800 new soles that she will use to buy 15 cases of different sized soft-drinks.  She works alone in her business; her husband works in the mine.

Her dream for the future is to have a distributorship.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the meetings.

loans.use: to buy 15 cases of various sized soft-drinks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
"I buy and sell empty shells, bottles and scrap iron to earn a living," says 62-year-old Antonia. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month with this business. Antonia also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like coffee, sugar and toiletries. Antonia's husband works as a fisherman and runs a small vulcanizing shop. Antonia is happy that she is able to support her family with her business.

Antonia has requested a loan to buy empty shells, bottles, scrap iron and plastics. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy empty shells, bottles, scrap iron and plastics
