Marisa is 39 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Marisa has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Marisa is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Hawa Issa

texts.fr:
Madame   HAWA ISSA est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec plusieurs autres familles dans le quartier Médine  de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales,  très vite, elle commença à faire les activités génératrices de revenus, notamment la tresse auprès de sa sœur qui faisait le métier de tresseuse de cheveux. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle  décida de s’installer à son propre comptant en menant la même activité en ouvrant un salon de coiffure. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force  est due à son génie de création.
Dans le souci d’être à la page et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 18 mois, après  3 prêts solidaires  bien remboursés. Elle   est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter, 1 machine séchoir  et 1 casque pour cheveux. Elle  s’approvisionnera sur place.
Madame  HAWA ISSA fait ses prestations  comptant et à crédit à des clients fidèles. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de diversifier ses activités génératrices de revenus.
Son ambition est   de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Hawa Issa is 40 years old, married, and mother of three children. She lives with several other families in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou.

Since she didn't go to school due to family reasons, she began performing revenue-generating activities from an early age. In particular, she began braiding hair with her sister, who braided hair for a living. After several years of learning by her sister's side, she decided to start her own business by opening up a hair salon for braiding hair. She has been running this business for the past 20 years and has a lot of experience and customers. Her greatest strength is her creativity.

She is seeking this loan in order to stay up to date and make more profit. She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 18 months now, after three group loans that were all correctly repaid. She is now on her first individual loan, which she will use to buy 1 hand-held hair-dryer and 1 freestanding hair-dryer. She stocks up in her town.

Hawa Issa provides her services for cash, or credit for her regular customers. With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA. These profits will allow her to pay back the interest on her loan and diversify her revenue-generating activities.

Her goal is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Mary Del Carmen Puentes Ballestero

texts.es: Mary compró sandalias de baño, artesanías, suvenires, broches y salidas de baño que vendió y ganó dinero, con el cual está fortaleciendo su negocio de producción de galletas y comidas, en el que también invirtió una parte de su anterior credikiva. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada con su negocio de comidas, porque le está yendo muy bien, por eso con un nuevo credikiva, al que en la actualidad está aplicando, comprará insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y otra parte la destinará a la compra de mercancías variadas, con las cuales dará respuesta a los pedidos de sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el apoyo, por ayudarla a sacar adelante sus negocios, con los cuales estoy sacando adelante a mi familia
texts.en: Mary bought flip flops, artisanal goods, souvenirs, brooches and cover ups that she sold and from which she made money with which she is reinforcing her cookie and food production business in which she also invested part of her previous credikiva. She is currently very excited about her food business because it is running very well. That is why she will use part of the money from the new credikiva for which she is currently applying to buy ingredients and the rest to buy diverse goods that she will use to meet the orders of her clients. Her message for the Kiva lenders is “Thank you for your support, for your help to keep my businesses running. They enable me to get my family ahead in life”.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food with part of the money and diverse goods with the rest.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Cristita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She is also into rice and corn farming. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cristita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cristita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. Eddie has a shop that sells plastic ware and clothing, like blouses and shirts. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing and plastic ware products for sale. Eddie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eddie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and plastic ware products for sale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1  hijo en estudio, la señora cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.
Hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de chifleria (productos de uso personal/varios).
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar candados, tubos para luz- agua, focos, pastas dentales, cepillos, escobas, etc, en el negocio le ayuda su hijo.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina is a member of the “United Hearts” Community Bank, which is located in the Desaguadero District, in the Chucuito Provence, in the department of Puno. She is 44 years old, is married and has one child in secondary school.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past six years. Her first loan was for 3,000 new soles. This loan she used to support her business that sells various personal use products. She is asking for a new loan of 2,000 new soles, which she will use to buy padlocks, fluorescent bulbs, water, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, brooms, etc. for this business that helps her child.
Her dream for the future is to improve her business.
What she likes the most about the community bank is that they are punctual and that they provide savings and earnings.

loans.use: to buy padlocks, fluorescent bulbs, water, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Judith has an electronics shop that provides repairs to home appliances and other electrical machines, where her husband is the main repairman. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services. Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Marjorie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Marjorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marjorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ruth has a shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She is also buying and selling gasoline per liter. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue. Ruth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue

loans.name: Margarita Delia

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, la señora realizó estudios de educación superior.
 	
Margarita recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de comidas (restaurante), comprará mercaderías  como papa, arroz, verduras, carnes, etc, para la preparación de  los alimentos, en le negocio le ayuda su esposo.

Su sueño para el futuro  crecer en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of  “The Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II” Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is thirty years old, married and has a child who is studying in a school of higher education.
Margarita recently began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She is asking for a loan of 500.00 new soles. This loan she will use for her restaurant business. She will buy merchandise such as potatoes, rice, vegetables, meats, etc. in order to prepare food in this business that she runs with the help of her husband. 
Her future goal is to grow her business.
What she like the best about the Community Bank is that it is easy to save and borrow money.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as potatoes, rice, vegetables, meats, etc.
